item.title:
R to @shoucccc: It seems the tx is leaked via auction feed (https://docs.48.club/puissant-builder/auction-transaction-feed). Last time, there was a public debate over MEV Blocker's similar endpoint, and generally, folks believed this could facilitate blind sandwiches.
Thanks @longteac @seaify1 for the info.
item.dc:creator: @shoucccc
item.description:
It seems the tx is leaked via auction feed (docs.48.club/puissant-buildeâ€¦). Last time, there was a public debate over MEV Blocker's similar endpoint, and generally, folks believed this could facilitate blind sandwiches.

Thanks @longteac @seaify1 for the info.

item.title:
Turns out @cz_binance sent the first $TST buy tx to private RPC, but that tx still got leaked somehow.
CZ's buy tx (https://bscscan.com/tx/0x84fba4557a3062ecfba9135cd75e95222a28dc24051f48fc9a4b750f1b24843e) set the minimum output to 363,225 TST, while at that block, he can receive up to 365,564 TST (~0.7% slippage). If this tx is not sent to the private RPC, then it can lead to a $200+ profit for the sandwich bot, and the sandwich bot must sandwich it. However, none did and the block builder payment was much lower than $200 at that block, so it is apparent that CZ used private RPC.
The reason that CZ's buy tx failed was due to someone buying TST ahead of CZ (https://bscscan.com/tx/0x9b2b3b99536bbe167e84f7852c5617b41a0096e9676bc68876f78772b555364f). Unfortunately, this guy got sandwiched. Block builder prioritized this tx with sandwich txs over CZ's tx because the sandwich bot made $0.2 payments to block builder. If CZ set his gas price to 1.5gwei, his tx would likely be prioritized and succeed.
The real suspicious thing is why would 0xB2d57876271eA8684e7c521c1265b87703d9A0DA (B1) know CZ is buying $TST in advance. The bot explicitly checked CZ's TST balance (if it succeeds) and attempted to backrun his transaction. Is the private orderflow shared with this bot? Maybe I am retarded and missed something, or I guess only the bot owner/block builder/relay knows.
item.dc:creator: @shoucccc
item.description:
Turns out @cz_binance sent the first $TST buy tx to private RPC, but that tx still got leaked somehow.

CZ's buy tx (bscscan.com/tx/0x84fba4557a3â€¦) set the minimum output to 363,225 TST, while at that block, he can receive up to 365,564 TST (~0.7% slippage). If this tx is not sent to the private RPC, then it can lead to a $200+ profit for the sandwich bot, and the sandwich bot must sandwich it. However, none did and the block builder payment was much lower than $200 at that block, so it is apparent that CZ used private RPC.

The reason that CZ's buy tx failed was due to someone buying TST ahead of CZ (bscscan.com/tx/0x9b2b3b99536â€¦). Unfortunately, this guy got sandwiched. Block builder prioritized this tx with sandwich txs over CZ's tx because the sandwich bot made $0.2 payments to block builder. If CZ set his gas price to 1.5gwei, his tx would likely be prioritized and succeed.

The real suspicious thing is why would 0xB2d57876271eA8684e7c521c1265b87703d9A0DA (B1) know CZ is buying $TST in advance. The bot explicitly checked CZ's TST balance (if it succeeds) and attempted to backrun his transaction. Is the private orderflow shared with this bot? Maybe I am retarded and missed something, or I guess only the bot owner/block builder/relay knows.

item.title:
RT by @shoucccc: what happened with @Bybit_Official just now?
1. hacker somehow constructed a tx to upgrade a bybit wallet code to a malicious version. https://etherscan.io/tx/0x46deef0f52e3a983b67abf4714448a41dd7ffd6d32d32da69d62081c68ad7882
2. hacker did a 90 USDT test tx to address under control https://etherscan.io/tx/0x25800d105db4f21908d646a7a3db849343737c5fba0bc5701f782bf0e75217c9
3. 1 minute later, the hacker transferred 400k ETH to the same hacker address https://etherscan.io/tx/0xb61413c495fdad6114a7aa863a00b2e3c28945979a10885b12b30316ea9f072c
4. as well as 800mETH, 90k stETH, and 15k cmETH https://etherscan.io/tx/0xbcf316f5835362b7f1586215173cc8b294f5499c60c029a3de6318bf25ca7b20
https://etherscan.io/tx/0xa284a1bc4c7e0379c924c73fcea1067068635507254b03ebbbd3f4e222c1fae0
5. the hacker quickly distributes assets into different addresses, trying to escape
https://etherscan.io/tx/0x6ce356b6205db32292a262692b8cb463bd5ade2d2c129d67a1ce38855ae9bd80
#Hacked #CryptoMarket #ETH
item.dc:creator: @ChazChazC
item.description:

item.title:
RT by @shoucccc: imo, at this point it doesnt matter if youre a user, dev, vc, trader, influencer, or anything else. as long as your plan isnt to max extract and leave, then one of your main priorities should be working together to purge the people who are dragging our reputation through the mud
were at the point where the average observer thinks crypto is just memecoins and scams, and unless youre in the memecoin and scam business then you should not be happy with this
item.dc:creator: @samczsun

item.title:
RT by @shoucccc: DefiTuna accepted an investment from Kelsier with a size of $30,000 which put Kelsier as the 2nd smallest investor in DefiTuna back in January 16, 2025.
Upon finding out about Kelsier's activities we have refunded Kelsier and cut all ties.

item.title: Arunkumar Sugadevan is unrelated to $LIBRA. They only share the same MM. I am super sorry for this wrong info. Arunkumar is in German, while the MM behind is in Delhi and is not Kelsier as well. More info soon.
